sen.j: 賀茂御祖神社（かもみおやじんじゃ）は、京都市左京区にある神社である。
sen.e: Kamomioya-jinja Shrine is located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kamomioya-jinja Shrine is located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kamomioya-jinja Shrine is located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 通称下鴨神社（しもがもじんじゃ）。
sen.e: It is commonly known as Shimogamo-jinja (Lower Kamo Shrine).
It is commonly known as Shimogamo-jinja Shrine (Lower Kamo Shrine).
It is commonly known as Shimogamo-jinja Shrine (Lower Kamo Shrine).

sen.j: 式内社、山城国一宮、二十二社の一社で、旧社格は官幣大社。
sen.e: It was listed in the Register of Deities (Jinmyocho) of the Engishiki law as one of the ichi-no-miya (primary shrines) of the former Yamashiro province and was categorized as a Kanpei Taisha (Great Imperial Shrine) under the previous shrine ranking system.
sen.cmt: ・Yamashiro province: プログレッシブ英和中辞典、およびhttp://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110004656143/
sen.e: It was a Shikinaisha, listed in the Register of Deities (jimmyocho) of the Engishiki law as one of the Nijunisha (The 22 shrines), ichi-no-miya (primary shrines) of the former Yamashiro province and was categorized as a Kanpei Taisha (Great Imperial Shrine) under the previous shrine ranking system.

It was a Shikinaisha, listed in the Register of Deities (jimmyocho) of the Engishiki law as one of the Nijunisha (The 22 shrines), ichi-no-miya (primary shrines) of the former Yamashiro province and was categorized as a Kampei Taisha (Great Imperial Shrine) under the previous shrine ranking system.

sen.j: 賀茂別雷神社（上賀茂神社）とともに古代の賀茂氏の氏神を祀る神社であり、賀茂神社（賀茂社）と総称され、両社をもって一社のような扱いをされてきた。
sen.e: Along with Kamo-wakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine (Kamigamo-jinja, or 'Upper Kamo Shrine') it enshrines ancient ujigami of the Kamo clan, and the pair generally being referred to as Kamo-jinja (Kamo-sha) and treated as paired shrines.

Along with Kamo-wakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine (Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, or 'Upper Kamo Shrine') it enshrines ancient ujigami of the Kamo clan, and the pair generally being referred to as Kamo-jinja Shrine (Kamo-sha) and treated as paired shrines.

Along with Kamo-wakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine (Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, or 'Upper Kamo Shrine') it enshrines ancient ujigami of the Kamo clan, and the pair generally being referred to as Kamo-jinja Shrine (Kamo-sha) and treated as paired shrines.

sen.j: 賀茂神社両社の祭事である賀茂祭（通称葵祭）で有名である。
sen.e: Both Kamo-jinja Shrines are well known for the Kamo Festival (Aoi-matsuri Festival).
Both Kamo-jinja Shrines are well known for the Kamo Festival (Aoi-matsuri Festival).
Both Kamo-jinja Shrines are well known for the Kamo Festival (Aoi-matsuri Festival).

sen.j: 上賀茂神社の祭神である賀茂別雷命の母のタマヨリビメと玉依姫命の父の賀茂建角身命を祀ることから「賀茂御祖神社」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The name 'Kamigamo-jinja Shrine' (upper shrine for ancestors of Kamo clan) is derived from the fact that the enshrined deity Kamowakeikazuchi-no-mikoto's mother Tamayorihime and her father Kamotaketsunumi-no-mikoto are also enshrined within.

It is called 'Kamomioya-jinja Shrine' from the fact that enshrines the deity of Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, Kamowakeikazuchi-no-mikoto's mother Tamayorihime-no-mikoto, and her father Kamotaketsunumi-no-mikoto within.
sen.cmt: 賀茂御祖神社→Kamomioya-jinja ShrineTamayorihime-no-mikotoに修正。※原文を勘違い？されているようなので、全体を訂正。
sen.e: It is called 'Kamomioya-jinja Shrine' from the fact that enshrines the deity of Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, Kamowakeikazuchi-no-mikoto's mother Tamayorihime-no-mikoto, and her father Kamotaketsunumi-no-mikoto within.

sen.j: 八咫烏は賀茂建角身命の化身である。
sen.e: The yata-garasu (three legged crow) personifies Kamotaketsunumi-no-mikoto.
The yata-garasu (three legged crow) personifies Kamotaketsunumi-no-mikoto.
The yata-garasu (three legged crow) personifies Kamotaketsunumi-no-mikoto.

sen.j: 付属施設に糺（ただす）の森、みたらし池がある。
sen.e: The site also includes the Tadasu-no-Mori forest and Mitarashi-ike pond.
The site also includes the Tadasu-no-Mori forest and Mitarashi-ike pond.
The site also includes the Tadasu-no-Mori forest and Mitarashi-ike pond.

sen.j: 京都の社寺でも最も古い部類に入る。
sen.e: The Shimogamo-jinja Shrine is one of the oldest shrines in Kyoto.
The Shimogamo-jinja Shrine is one of the oldest shrines in Kyoto.
The Shimogamo-jinja Shrine is one of the oldest shrines in Kyoto.

sen.j: 社伝では、神武天皇の御代に御蔭山に祭神が降臨したと伝える。
sen.e: According to legend, the enshrined deity descended at Mt. Mikage-yama during the reign of Emperor Jimmu.
sen.cmt: ・Emperor Jimmu: 英辞郎 on the WEB (-天皇)
sen.e: According to legend, the enshrined deity descended at Mt. Mikage-yama during the reign of Emperor Jimmu.
According to legend, the enshrined deity descended at Mt. Mikage-yama during the reign of Emperor Jimmu.

sen.j: また、崇神天皇7年（紀元前90年）に神社の瑞垣の修造が行われたとの記録があり、この頃の創建ではないかとの説がある。
sen.e: There are records of the fence surrounding the honden (main hall) being repaired in AD 90 and some theories claim that the shrine may have been established around this time.
There are records of the fence surrounding the honden (main hall) being repaired in AD 90 and some theories claim that the shrine may have been established around this time.
There are records of the fence surrounding the honden (main hall) being repaired in BC 90 and some theories claim that the shrine may have been established around this time.

sen.j: 一説には、天平のころに上賀茂神社から分置されたともされる。
sen.e: One theory even claims that this shrine was split from Kamigamo-jinja Shrine during the Tenpyo period.
One theory even claims that this shrine was split from Kamigamo-jinja Shrine during the Tenpyo period.
One theory even claims that this shrine was split from Kamigamo-jinja Shrine during the Tempyo period.

sen.j: 上賀茂神社とともに奈良時代以前から朝廷の崇敬を受けた。
sen.e: Along with Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, this shrine has been revered by the imperial court since before the Nara period.
Along with Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, this shrine has been revered by the Imperial Court since before the Nara period.
Along with Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, this shrine has been revered by the Imperial Court since before the Nara period.

sen.j: 平安遷都の後はより一層の崇敬を受けるようになり、大同2年（807年）には最高位である正一位の神階を受け、賀茂祭は勅祭とされた。
sen.e: After the capital was relocated to Heian, the shrine became even more highly revered by the imperial court and was granted the highest possible status, with the Kamo Festival being held by royal order.

After the capital was relocated to Heian, the shrine became even more highly revered by the Imperial Court and was granted the highest possible status, 'Sho-Ichii,' with the Kamo Festival being held by royal order.
sen.cmt: the Imperial Courtに修正。'Sho-Ichii,'を補足。
sen.e: After the capital was relocated to Heian, the shrine became even more highly revered by the Imperial Court and was granted the highest possible status, Shoichii (Senior First Rank), in 807 with the Kamo Festival being held by royal order.
sen.cmt: in 807補足'Sho-Ichii,'→"Shoichii (Senior First Rank),"に変更しました。

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳では名神大社に列し、名神・月次・相嘗・新嘗の各祭の幣帛に預ると記載されている。
sen.e: The Jimmyocho (the list of deities) of the Engishiki law ranks it as a Myojin Taisha (a grand shrine that enshrines a high-ranked deity) and states that it held the Myojin-sai festival, Tsukinami-sai festival, Ainame-sai festival and Niname-sai festival.

The Jimmyocho (the list of deities) of the Engishiki law ranks it as a Myojin Taisha (a grand shrine that enshrines a high-ranked deity) and states that received offerings at each festival such as the Myojin-sai festival, Tsukinami-sai festival, Ainame-sai festival and Niname-sai festival.
sen.cmt: "各祭の幣帛に預かる"、部分が抜けているので、英訳して追加。
sen.e: The Jimmyocho (the list of deities) of the Engishiki law ranks it as a Myojin Taisha (a grand shrine that enshrines a high-ranked deity) and states that received offerings at each festival such as the Myojin-sai festival, Tsukinami-sai festival, Ainame-sai festival and Niname-sai festival.

sen.j: 弘仁元年（810年）以降約400年にわたり、斎院が置かれ皇女が斎王として賀茂社に奉仕した。
sen.e: For approximately 400 years from 810, unmarried imperial princesses served as Saiin and Saio (priestesses) at the shrine.
For approximately 400 years from 810, unmarried imperial princesses served as Saiin and Saio (priestesses) at the Kamo-sha shrine.
For approximately 400 years from 810, unmarried imperial princesses served as Saiin and Saio (priestesses) at the Kamo-sha shrine.

sen.j: 1月15日：御粥祭
5月3日：流鏑馬神事
5月12日：御蔭祭
5月15日：葵祭

sen.j: 927年（延長 (元号)5年）12月26日：＜延喜式完成。＞
967年（康保4年）7月9日：＜延喜式施行。＞
1871年5月14日（明治4年）：＜社格制度制定＞
